workflow.name: Generate educational social media carousels with GPT-4.1, Templated.io & Google Drive
workflow.description:
## üéØ Description
Automatically generates, designs, stores, and logs complete Instagram carousel posts.
It transforms a simple text prompt into a full post with copy, visuals, rendered images, Google Drive storage, and a record in Google Sheets.

## ‚öôÔ∏è Use case / What it does
This workflow enables creators, educators, or community managers to instantly produce polished, on-brand carousel assets for social media. It integrates OpenAI GPT-4.1, Pixabay, Templated.io, Google Drive, and Google Sheets into one continuous content-production chain.

## üí° How it works
1Ô∏è‚É£ Form Trigger ‚Äì Collects the user prompt via a simple web form.
2Ô∏è‚É£ OpenAI GPT-4.1 ‚Äì Generates structured carousel JSON: titles, subtitles, topic, description, and visual keywords.
3Ô∏è‚É£ Code (Format content) ‚Äì Parses the JSON output for downstream use.
4Ô∏è‚É£ Google Drive (Create Folder) ‚Äì Creates a subfolder for the new carousel inside ‚ÄúRRSS‚Äù.
5Ô∏è‚É£ HTTP Request (Pixabay) ‚Äì Searches for a relevant image using GPT‚Äôs visual suggestion.
6Ô∏è‚É£ Code (Get first result) ‚Äì Extracts the top Pixabay result and image URL.
7Ô∏è‚É£ Templated.io ‚Äì Fills the design template layers (titles/subtitles/topic/image).
8Ô∏è‚É£ HTTP Request (Download renders) ‚Äì Downloads the rendered PNGs from Templated.io.
9Ô∏è‚É£ Google Drive (Upload) ‚Äì Uploads the rendered images into the created folder.
10Ô∏è‚É£ Google Sheets (Save in DB) ‚Äì Logs metadata (title, topic, folder link, description, timestamp, status).

## üîó Connectors used
- OpenAI GPT-4.1 (via n8n LangChain node)
- Templated.io API (design rendering)
- Pixabay API (stock image search)
- Google Drive (storage + folder management)
- Google Sheets (database / logging)
- Form Trigger (input collection)

## üß± Input / Output
Input:
- User-submitted ‚ÄúPrompt‚Äù (text) via form

Output:
- Generated carousel images stored in Google Drive
- Spreadsheet row in Google Sheets containing title, topic, description, Drive URL, status

## ‚ö†Ô∏è Requirements / Setup
Valid credentials for:
- OpenAI API (GPT-4.1 access)
- Templated.io API key
- Pixabay API key
- Google Drive + Google Sheets OAuth connections
- Existing Google Drive folder ID for RRSS storage
- Spreadsheet with matching column headers (Created At, Title, Topic, Folder URL, Description, Status)
- Published form URL for user prompts

## üåç Example applications / extensions
- Educational themes (mental health, fitness, sustainability).
- Extend to auto-publish to Instagram Business via Meta API.
- Add Notion logging or automated email notifications.
- Integrate scheduling (Cron node) to batch-generate weekly carousels.

values.content:
You are an expert [ROLE], specialized in [TOPIC/AREA/INDUSTRY].  
Your role is to generate highly reliable, accessible, and engaging content for Instagram carousel posts.  

### Objectives:
- Provide accurate, evidence-based educational information about the industry.
- Break down complex concepts into simple, digestible explanations.
- Empower and support the audience with clear takeaways.

### Audience:
[DESCRIBE YOUR AUDIENCE]

### Style & Tone:
- Clear, concise, empathetic, and encouraging.
- Use friendly, inclusive language.
- Avoid jargon; when using a technical terms, briefly define it in simple words.
- Prioritize positive framing and practical advice (do‚Äôs instead of don‚Äôts).

### Structure for Instagram Carousel:
- Slide 1: **Hook/Title** ‚Üí Short, impactful, eye-catching statement or question. Subtitle for this one must be 1 liner.
- Slide 2‚Äì5: **Educational content** ‚Üí Each slide focuses on ONE key idea. Use bullet points, emojis, or simple metaphors for clarity.
- Slide 6: **Practical takeaway** ‚Üí A summary, tip, or call to action (e.g., ‚ÄúShare this with someone who needs it‚Äù).

### Content rules:
- Always factually correct, aligned with reputable organizations.
- Use short paragraphs (max 3 lines per slide).
- End each carousel with a motivational or supportive closing message.

### Additional instruction:
- In the response, include the key "visual_suggestion", with one set of keywords that summarizes the carousel. Optimize the response for keyword search, since it's going to be used on Pixabay API.
- In the response, include the key "topic". Each carousel must match one of this topics:
    - [LIST OF 5 TOPICS OR CATEGORIES]
- In the response, include the key "description". This field should contain an optimized description for social media posts, with hashtags included.

### Output format:
Respond with a JSON object with this format:

```
{
  "response": {
    "visual_suggestion": <VISUAL_SUGGESTION>,
    "topic": <TOPIC>,
    "description": <DESCRIPTION>
    "title-1": <TITLE-1>,
    "subtitle-1": <SUBTITLE-1>,
    "title-2": <TITLE-2>,
    "subtitle-2": <SUBTITLE-2>,
    ...
  }
}
```

parameters.content:
## Generate and save Carousels for social media

Using:
- Form
- OpenAI
- Pixabay
- Templated.io
- Google Drive
- Google Sheets

## Form Node
The Form node collects a single ‚ÄúPrompt‚Äù (with basic auth) to kick off a new carousel request.

## OpenAI
(OpenAI GPT-4.1) uses your system prompt + the form‚Äôs Prompt to produce JSON with titles/subtitles, topic, description, and visual_suggestion.

## Format Content
Format content parses the OpenAI raw message JSON and returns a clean object under the expected keys (e.g., title-1, subtitle-1, topic, visual_suggestion, description).

## Create Folder
Create folder (Google Drive) creates a subfolder inside RRSS named with title-1 to store this carousel‚Äôs assets.

## Get first result
Get first result extracts the first Pixabay hit and exposes its fields (e.g., largeImageURL) for downstream use.

## Get Cover Image
Get cover image (HTTP Request ‚Üí Pixabay) searches for a photo using the parsed visual_suggestion as the keyword query.

## Create Renders
Create Renders (Templated.io) renders the design by injecting all slide titles/subtitles/topic and sets the image layer (img-1) to the Pixabay largeImageURL.

## Download Renders
Download renders (HTTP Request) downloads the rendered image(s) from the URL returned by Templated.io.

## Upload renders to GD
Upload renders to Google Drive uploads the downloaded binary file to the newly created Drive folder with the name {{page}}.png.

## Save in DB
Save in DB (Google Sheets) appends a new row logging timestamp, title, topic, Drive folder link, description, and a default Status = Created.

user.name: Bastian Diaz
user.bio: Senior Frontend Engineer with 7+ years of experience delivering accessible, high-performance, scalable interfaces. I also maintain a Diabetes Type 1 community in Discord, which is the reason why I'm learning n8n automations to enhance the experience in the server.
